channel.title: Patrick S. Kelso
channel.description: Recent content on Patrick S. Kelso

item.title: Conferencess and Community
item.description: In the last two weeks I’ve attended two conferences hosted by organisations based in North America. The experiences I had as an Australian in Sydney were vastly difference. One conference - I’m going to refer to it as Conf1 - leveraged technology to create opportunities for community and serendipity. The other - Conf2 - seemed to be optimised for marketing metrics.

item.title: Minimum CD
item.description: At the 2021 US DevOps Enterprise Summit I participated in a multi-day discussion around the definition of CD (Continuous Delivery). Bryan Finster started us off with a rough draft of his ideas and we built it into a manifest.

item.title: Patrick S. Kelso
item.description: I like solving problems and long walks on the beach. Check my LinkedIn to see where I am working now. I teach consulting and problem solving at the University of Technology Sydney where I am quite active in several societies helping the next generation of consultants and IT professionals kick-start their career.

item.title: IT Certifications
item.description: This is a rehash of advice I regularly give undergraduate students at UTS when they ask me what certification they should get.

item.title: Advice for students
item.description: A collection of things I wish I’d known when I started my career. Mostly a list of books to read or activities to do.
